title: height
description: Write a function `height` that takes a binary search tree and returns the height of the tree. The height of an empty tree is 0, and the height of a single node is 1.

examples.explanation: A single node tree has height 1
Tree with root and two children has height 2

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (height t))

(height empty)
(height (make-node empty empty 5))
(height (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5))
hiddenCases: (check-expect (height (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5)) 3)
(check-expect (height (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 15) 12) 10)) 4)
(check-expect (height (make-node empty (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 13) empty 17) (make-node empty empty 25) 20) 15)) 4)
(check-expect (height (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 4) empty 6) empty 9) (make-node (make-node empty empty 14) (make-node empty empty 18) 16) 12)) 5)
